Text: It actually...opened...

Hey, it better have after all we went through.
Now, let's take a peek inside...
*gasp*
*gasp*
Wh-What...was that? Some kind of illusion?
I-I...felt it too... Some...overpowering presence...

It's not too late to turn back, you know?
...Just kidding.
N-No...let's keep going... We've come...this far...

Beyond the huge door is a spacious laboratory.
Zeta and Eta are rendered speechless by the sight
that leaps into their eyes.
What...is that?
A dragon? Is it...alive?

The back wall is made of glass, behind which
"something" sleeps in a culture fluid...
A black...
Dragon...

Zeta manages to stir her stunned legs back to life
and approach the glass wall.

We came here to investigate the Tears of Diablos,
but then we stumble upon this... It's like some kind
of bad dream.

Is it...a monster? No, dragons aren't just monsters,
are they... Ugh, I can't wrap my head around this...
Incredible...

Eta approaches the glass wall as if drawn to it.
She looks spellbound as she gazes at the dragon,
as if completely enthralled by it.
U-Uh, Eta? Be careful...

*sigh*... Laugus... You really had something
crazy squirreled away, didn't you...
...Huh? What have we here...
Zeta reaches out and picks up a nearby book.
This binding is just like the journal...

Zeta opens the book. As she suspected, it's a journal
of Lord Laugus's, just like the one they found in the
library a moment ago.

—I've finally found it. My theories were correct.
I've successfully created an artificial aperture to
a world in another dimension.

A world in another dimension? Artificial aperture?
What's he talking about?

Zeta reads more of the journal full of similar
unusual terminology.

—Based on the level of magic flowing through this
world, I can presume it is not a higher realm of much
magnitude. Nevertheless, this is undoubtedly the
first step toward a revolution.

—It is the possible existence of multiple such
worlds and rulers of these worlds that is truly
important.

—At last, I succeeded in capturing one of these
otherworldly kings. Though all others involved in
the process aside from myself may have perished
in doing so, that is of no concern.

—I am of a mind to leave this king as a gift for
fellow souls possessed of a keen mind...in the hope
that someone may yet be my equal one day.

—I have named these other-dimensional worlds
coursing with magic "realms," with the land where the
black dragon dwelt being the "12th Realm." As for
the king of that realm, I dub him—
—Nidhogg...
Eta? What happ—

What the?! The dragon's eyes are open! Eta, what
did you do?!
N-Nothing...

All I did...was press a few of these buttons while
inspecting things...
That's not "nothing"!
More importantly—
More importantly?!
It's moving...

The black dragon begins to stir lazily in its fluid
prison. The magic chains binding its limbs vanish,
and then...
The glass wall shatters.
It's...coming this way...

A-Anyway, we need to put some distance between it and
us! This way!
Grooooooooarrrr!!!
Th-This is bad... We need to stop it!

Zeta tries attacking the dragon, but it doesn't even
flinch.
Guess we can forget that idea!
...Eta! Look out!
Nidhogg slashes down at Eta with its sharp claws.
I-I'm fine... I can fend it off with slime...

Look at those gouges in the floor... One hit and
we're done for...
But we...don't have...any choice...
True... Here it comes!!!
Grooooooooarrrr!!!
